dt: {bc}to perform an act, function, or operation in turn
{bc}to pass or alternate in a series
{bc}to turn about an axis or a center {bc}{sx|revolve||}
{bc}to move in such a way that all particles follow circles with a common angular velocity about a common axis
{bc}to cause to turn or move about an axis or a center
{bc}to cause (a plane region or line) to sweep out a volume or surface by moving around an axis so that each of its points remains at a constant distance from the axis

dt.t: generate a torus by {it}rotating{/it} a circle about an external line

dt: {bc}to cause to pass or act in a series {bc}{sx|alternate||}

et: Latin {it}rotatus{/it}, past participle of {it}rotare{/it}, from {it}rota{/it} wheel {ma}{mat|roll|}{/ma}
shortdef: to perform an act, function, or operation in turn
to pass or alternate in a series
to turn about an axis or a center : revolve; especially : to move in such a way that all particles follow circles with a common angular velocity about a common axis
